Introducing a new dynamic system called “Grades” that makes luxury fashion for all.(Not for poorest)(from first year)
Introduce the most beautiful dynamic designs(new) to attract customers(from first year)
Despite our 10 wholesalers in 7 major countries in the world that we have already, we will create more huge amount of channels      for marketing. More wholesalers, retailers, online marketing(from 1° yr)
Introduce a new fashion technology for the first time: The fashion technology collection is made of three devices: Scio device, smart bag Shoulder Belt Device and Medical device. (from 2° year)
Luxury fashion mechanic: High heel equilibrium to 65% of women worldwide who have difficulty walking on high heel(from 3° year). To understand solution, you can see this video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EFpRLjmAicc 
Introducing the possibilities of Luxury Fashion at your command: Depending on your budget (from 4th year)
Introduce New Fashion Traveling Office(Technologies):This will come with executive GINIK  traveling bags that make you connected with your office. Even if your office is in New York but you are in London for any purpose, as long as you have your GINIK traveling bag, your office is right  there with you.(from 5° year)
Introduce new Fashion Portable Office(Technologies): (from 6° year)
Introduce new children’s line(from 8° year)
Introduce sports line(from 10° year)



In order to stand before our competitors, these above several strategies, solutions and actions are going to be implemented for the first time in the world of Luxury Fashion Industry.




GINIK is an up-and-coming Italian designer brand on a mission to change the phrase from “what you see is
what you get” to “what you want is what you get.”

GINIK designs and produces stylish fashion technology, elegant bags, shoes and other accessories that gives
you unprecedented levels of choice and control over the quality and feel of your accessories.

Made of the the finest materials, our GINIK designs are meticulously crafted by experienced Italian craftsmen
to indulge you in the world of high fashion.

Beautiful designs, beautiful quality at your command. That’s the GINIK philosophy. 








There's always a game of give and take in the world of fashion, but at GINIK we’re making it our mission to
change that by introducing a unique "grade" model that gives you the freedom to choose, not just the style, but
the quality and craftsmanship that match your lifestyle -- and your budget.
Say goodbye to your days of choosing between fashion, lifestyle and affordability, because with GINIK, you
can have all. 



My dear, we have finally found investors but our problem is that we were asked to present ourselves with a prototype and a presentation video inform of Advertisement. The promotional video is because they want to know the kind of company we are building to compete our competitors. We are here to seek for your support so that we can produce the fashion electronic prototype and the video which is going to be registered in Venice Italy. We have to make it to the standard.We estimated a total of $19.500. But currently we have only $10.000. This is why we are here to seek for your support for the rest of $9.500
Location:  Hotel Danieli, Venice, Italy.



We don't want to go down to the details explaining to you what Fashion Electronic is all about to avoid copyright but believe us is something new with a great idea mainly for women that want to update their luxury lifestyle and is affordable for all. Then Fashion Technology is all about handbag with technologies...
We know that not all of you might be interested in our perks but we will still come back here to appreciate your concern by offering you our Fashion Electronic bag.  We want to do it because these $9.500 worth a lot to us if we will be able to have these video and prototype done. So please, even is you don't want our perks, please you can still donate whatever you have. We will still come back to you with offers.

We are in 21° century and is high time to solve our problems which is GINIK's mission to do so.


MISSION
GINIK is on a mission to change the phrase from “what you see is what you get” to “what you want is what you get.”


PRODUCTS
GINIK designs and produces stylish, elegant bags, shoes and other accessories that gives you unprecedented levels of choice and control over the quality and feel of your accessories.




PRODUCTIONMade of the the finest materials, our GINIK designs are meticulously crafted by experienced Italian craftsmen to indulge you in the world of high fashion. All made in ITALY.
Beautiful designs, beautiful quality at your command. That’s the GINIK philosophy.


Our products are made by the same experienced Italian craftsmen that have been in existence since 1964(5th generation of an antique Italian company since 1901). The same companies that brought up and produce for GUCCI, CAVALLI, PRADA, etc. I'm working for these companies. If not, I wouldn't have the possibility to the opportunity they gave to me.




COMPETITORS
My competitors are GUCCI, PRADA, LOUIS VUITTON, etc 


Say goodbye to your days of choosing between fashion, lifestyle and affordability, because with GINIK, you can have all.
MATERIALS


The world most expensive animal leathers are:  which most of my competitors do not use.

1. Stingray Found in: Europe Africa: The Stingray is the skin, tanned, Shark Scyliorhinus canicula also called dogfish or race cowtail stingray. Because of its high production cost is used for the coating of objects of prestige. The skin of Galuchat is a type of skin is very hard and durable and can last a very long time. It is named after its first owner, Jean-Claude Galuchat a French craftsman died in 1774 he was in the service of King Louis XV.
2. Crocodile Found in: Africa USA India
3. Seal Found in: Green Land Ice Land
4. Snake Found : Globally
5. Kangaroo Found in: Australia
6. Ostrich Found in: Africa
7. Deer Found in: Globally* Except*- Greenland, Africa, Ice Land
8. Whale Found : Globally
9. Walrus Found in: Canada Greenland
10. Yak Found : Central Asia

GINIK is the new up-and-coming designer brand that brings personalization to your shopping experience.


At GINIK, we give our customers what they want by offering the same model of bags, shoes and more at a variety of prices, each corresponding to a specific grade of leather. There are five major grades to choose from, of the same model/design but different leathers, all of which are high-quality genuine leather. And will be easy to differentiate them.
This idea is to let everyone have what he/she wants. If our president has one of our models/designs at his price, you poor one can still have the same design/model with/at your own price.
Whether you happen upon a GINIK design in a boutique or online retailer, you choose which design you love most, pick the quality of leather you’d like and you’ll get the design in the grade you want. Before you get your buttery leather GINIK bag or shoes, each product is tested before shipped off to your happy arms or feet.
Do not change your life style but its only a matter of how high you’d like to upgrade it...


At GINIK, we believe that a bag should be as unique as you are. After all, it follows you wherever you go and, let’s face it, it carries around your whole life for you.
Our designs are creative and sophisticated, so you can wear your bag from your office to an evening soiree.



Ginika doesn’t just share a related name with the brand. He’s the bold visionist behind the company. Born in Nigeria, Ginika relocated to Italy in 2007 to work with the hottest brands in the fashion industry including Gucci, etc. 
Have his company in USA in 2014. 
His outstanding fashion connections have come in handy in the founding of GINIK and his creativity can be found in every fiber of our products.





We are here to seek for your support so that we can produce more prototypes with these strategies, solutions and actions as already mentioned above. And then to be able to present what we have to investors.




How our solutions are better:
Luxury Fashion Technologies, Luxury Fashion grades, Luxury Fashion Electronics  Luxury Fashion Mechanics, Luxury Fashion at your command, lower prices, dynamic designs to attract customers, etc.






GINIK is the new up-and-coming designer brand that brings personalization to your shopping experience.


At GINIK, we give our customers what they want by offering the same model of bags, shoes and more at a variety of prices, each corresponding to a specific grade of leather. There are five major grades to choose from, all of which are high-quality.
Do not change your life style but its only a matter of how high you’d like to upgrade it...
At GINIK, we believe that a bag should be as unique as you are. After all, it follows you wherever you go and, let’s face it, it carries around your whole life for you.
Our designs are creative and sophisticated, so you can wear your bag from your office to an evening soiree.
But we don’t want to leave you with an amazing bag hanging off your arm without the perfect accessories to complement it. That’s just rude. That’s why GINIK offers a variety of beautifully made shoes and wristwatches to complete your look.





Whether you happen upon a GINIK design in a boutique or online retailer, you choose which design you love most, pick the quality of leather you’d like and you’ll get the design in the grade you want. Before you get your buttery leather GINIK bag or shoes, each product is tested before shipped off to your happy arms or feet.







We have prototypes for several of our unique designs of bags and shoes that are out and ready for the fashion world to see.
  
We are also collaborating with fashion giants Luisa Via Roma and Net-A-Porter, who are online carriers of luxury brands that ship nationwide. We have made deals with shops throughout London, France, USA, Australia, Germany, Italy, Denmark, Nigeria, and Japan who are waiting to make GINIK bags and accessories available to their clientele.
         


Preparation hasn’t stopped there — even the finest details have been covered. We have connections with SNATT, which is one of the largest logistics companies in Europe and has the ability to propel the company from quality control to packaging.

Watch out Gucci, Prada, and Louis Vuitton: GINIK has dug deep into European fashion and is ready to take the fashion industry by storm. Request access to the Business Plan of this profile to learn more about how GINIK will use market, model, management and momentum to become the biggest name in fashion!






Luxury Fashion Technology Partners


SCiO from Israel: part of GINIK Fashion Technology
SCiO will provide a part of the software to develop our Fashion Technology. It's very important to GINIK 

EB Elektrobit from Israel finalizes our Fashion Technology: EB Elektrobit will also develop a part of our software to finalize our Fashion Technology.
It's very important to GINIK. 





{}p#


Luxury Fashion Electronic Partner
 SN SYSTEM from Italy: They will develope the mechanism of our Fashion Electronic




{}p#


Luxury Fashion Mechanic
 Contitech from Israel: will realize and produce only the dynamic system of our fashion mechanic for the equilibrium of high heels










Chukwujama Izuchukwu GinikaGinika doesn’t just share a related name with the brand. He’s the bold visionist behind the company. Born in Nigeria, Ginika relocated to Italy in 2007 to work with the hottest brands in the fashion industry including Gucci. His outstanding fashion connections have come in handy in the founding of GINIK and his creativity can be found in every fiber of our products.

story:
Beep beep :)

Little did we know that the campaign would reach the targeted amount in such a short span. Here is a big shout out to all the contributors who made this campaign a hugeee success. THANK YOU :). We are overwhelmed by the love and support shown by each one of you who contributed and helped spread the word. The boys are all geared up for WCBU. 

The Story :

India is sending an exciting team to participate at WCBU 2015, the World Championship of Beach Ultimate, that's happening 8th - 13th March. We need your support to send our two strongest players! Thangam (Thangaraj Murugan), and Tharon (Sreetharon) have been selected as part of the Mixed and Open team respectively, but are unable to afford the costs of attending the tournament without help.

WCBU is at Dubai this year, and so it will be the first time that Thangam and Tharon will be traveling outside India. Coming from less than privileged backgrounds, Thangam supports his aged parents and his siblings, from food to their education. Tharon is thinking of becoming an Ultimate Frisbee coach. It costs $1065 each for them to make it to Beach Worlds, and is nearly impossible for them to afford on their own.

The sport has transformed their lives in more ways than we can imagine, and it’s a great honor for the extremely talented and hardworking boys to be representing India in Dubai. Ultimate Frisbee is a great tool for social change, and we need your help. Each donation no matter how small helps bring them one step closer to realizing their dream of playing for their country.


Where does your money go :

Expenses per player

USD ($)

Team registration

 200

Individual registration

 50

Airfare

 280

Visa

 100

Accommodation

 150

Jersey

 25

Transport

 40

Food

 130

Admin Charges

 90

Total per player

 1065


Other ways you can help :

If you cannot contribute, please consider spreading the word! Thank you :)


Reach out to us :

We are more than happy to talk to you, be it about Thangam or Tharon or the WCBU expenses. 

ashleo31@gmail.com
tharakai.natesan@gmail.com

story:
Our designs emerged from a dissatisfaction with the generic minimalism that is currently flooding the micro-brand watch field. As designers, we view the watch as an artistic canvas, and are excited by its unique creative possibilities. But most watches never fulfill this potential. 

We wanted to completely re-imagine watch design, to create a timepiece that makes the most of this medium's uniqueness. And the most unique and fundamental part of a watch, as we see it, is movement. We were inspired by the potential of using time's movement to create visual beauty, and perhaps even philosophical meaning.

In our design research, we drew inspiration from the Kinetic Art movement, vibrant in the early 20th century. Kinetic artists broke from traditional static art pieces, and created art that produced beauty through movement. These innovative visual experiences created new interactive relationships between the artwork and the viewer.

 

Since the industrial revolution, we have become subservient to external routines. Time has become a number used to regiment our lives.  

Our Kinetic Art designs use the movement of time to reconceive the watch's purpose. Instead of a keeper of routine, our watches turn time into spellbinding art, revealing the beauty of the flowing present.

Time is no longer a number — time is beauty, time is art. The present is no longer to be planned away, but to be appreciated, as the flow of time mesmerizes and enchants us.

Beyond pointing out a few unique visual aspects of each work, we will refrain from in-depth exposition here, as we believe the meaning of a work shouldn't be shackled by the creator.  

Instead, the abstract kinetics in each design are springboards from which each viewer can draw different personal meanings and inspirations. We have already been pleasantly surprised by the diversity of interpretations we have received. We hope our watches will move you, too.

Please note that when we upgraded our discs, we have also improved on our Kinetic Art designs. The designs below are final, and slightly different from the designs seen in the other sections of this campaign.

 

 
 

Four concentric rings of circles constitute this design. Alternating expansion and contraction make a play of perspective. Round forms, linear layers and smooth animation scales work together to produce a balanced design. 

This ambitious design discards geometricism, using the overlapping of uneven layers to produce organic forms that morph as they spiral outwards. Varying angles create an illusion of differing speeds, adding to the design's dynamism. 

Using three sculpted discs instead of two, this design allows for more variation across time. Patterns change in symmetry and size as the hour and minute discs move across one another.  

If David hadn't stepped into the world of design, he would have been working in the non-profit field. Even now, giving back remains a personal necessity in each of his design projects.  

To keep with this vision, 5% of our sales will be donated to The Red Pencil, a non-profit that uses arts therapy to help those suffering from emotional trauma. Read more about their work with survivors of natural disasters, domestic abuse and human trafficking here.

Designing a watch requires hundreds of small choices, and at every crossroads, we have chosen the path that leads to quality. Here's an introduction to the premium components we use to craft our watches.

Unlike quartz watches which are powered by batteries, automatic watches are powered by human motion. Your arm's movement propels the hundreds of gears and springs precisely assembled in the watch mechanism — a feat of engineering artistry, and a refreshing change from the electronic circuitry we have gotten so used to. 

After much research, we chose the Japanese Seiko NH35A movement to power our watch, famed for its durability and reliability. A generation ahead of the already robust 7S26 and 8215, the NH35A is more refined, more accurate, and comes with hand-winding and hacking capabilities.

Our custom movement design is a tribute to the Kinetic artists of the last century, who struggled with the tensions between human and machine as their lives became increasingly mechanized, even as they used these new machines in their art. 

In a way, the automatic watch, as a human-powered mechanism, is a vivid illustration of that relationship. It is poetic that the mesmerizing movement of time in your Kinetic Art watch will be propelled by your own movement.

To frame our kinetic art, we designed a case that is minimalistic, almost geometric, with carefully balanced proportions, symmetrical bevels, and clean, angular forms. 

The case is made from brushed 316L surgical steel, which is much hardier than the cheaper and more common 304L steel.

Designed to be water resistant to 5 ATM, our watches can be brought to the shower or the pool. However, we suggest you order an extra Milanese mesh band if you intend to get your watch wet, as leather straps are prone to water damage.

Sapphire Crystal is incredibly scratch-resistant, rating '9' on the Mohs scale of hardness, just one spot behind diamonds. We use sapphire crystal for both the top and bottom glass, with additional anti-reflective coating applied on the top glass.

Our straps are vegetable-tanned — a natural leather processing method that's much more time consuming than the more commonly found chemical-based chrome-tanning method. Vegetable-tanned leather ages beautifully, developing a patina over time.  

We use full-grain leather for our straps — the strongest and most natural-looking type of leather, as it comes from the uppermost surface of the hide, where all the "grain" is preserved.

Our leather straps come with quick release pins for easy removal. You can order additional 316L Milanese mesh straps for a different look.

All our watches are painstakingly hand-assembled. The expert levels of dexterity and skill required to handle our vanishingly thin discs mean that only veteran watch makers are able to assemble our watches.

We are perfectionists here at Humism, and we take quality very seriously. All watch components are meticulously inspected before assembly, and multiple thorough inspections are carried out throughout the assembly process.  

All watches are put through a series of stringent quality control tests, such as water resistance and drop tests. We take the additional step of manually regulating each watch's movement to ensure they keep time accurately.

Our watches come with an 18 month warranty.

However, we suggest you order an extra Milanese mesh band if you intend to get your watch wet, as leather straps are prone to water damage.Sapphire Crystal is incredibly scratch-resistant, rating '9' on the Mohs scale of hardness, just one spot behind diamonds. We use sapphire crystal for both the top and bottom glass, with additional anti-reflective coating applied on the top glass.Our straps are vegetable-tanned — a natural leather processing method that's much more time consuming than the more commonly found chemical-based chrome-tanning method. Vegetable-tanned leather ages beautifully, developing a patina over time.  We use full-grain leather for our straps — the strongest and most natural-looking type of leather, as it comes from the uppermost surface of the hide, where all the "grain" is preserved.Our leather straps come with quick release pins for easy removal. You can order additional 316L Milanese mesh straps for a different look. 

First forged in 19th century Italy, these straps are uniquely stylish, comfortable, and hardy. Add a set to your pledge if you'll like a different style option, or see yourself getting your watch wet.
Milanese Mesh Strap in Silver
Milanese Mesh Strap in Black

All our watches are painstakingly hand-assembled. The expert levels of dexterity and skill required to handle our vanishingly thin discs mean that only veteran watch makers are able to assemble our watches.We are perfectionists here at Humism, and we take quality very seriously. All watch components are meticulously inspected before assembly, and multiple thorough inspections are carried out throughout the assembly process.  All watches are put through a series of stringent quality control tests, such as water resistance and drop tests. We take the additional step of manually regulating each watch's movement to ensure they keep time accurately.Our watches come with an 18 month warranty. 

With 39mm case sizes, our watches can be worn by both men and women. Our leather straps will fit most wrist sizes.

story:
Short Summary

Buy A Hat + Give A Hat + Teach A Child

ERAKY has been founded by a teacher who has taught for 13 years in low income communities throughout Alaska and who has, first hand, seen children struggling to stay warm without proper clothing in cold weather. In addition she has endured losing 18 of her former students to suicide, including her native son. The buy one, give one model seemed like a sustainable way to provide warm hats for kids in need, as well as an avanue for promoting suicide prevention education for the young people of rural Alaska. (see video). 

Although Alaska is our starting base, our long term plan is to not only meet the needs of Alaskan young people but also to extend our gift of warmth and  needed education to children in need worldwide. 

 

Behind The Name: 

ERAKY

(Give Every Reason for A Kid to say Yes...To Life and A Brighter Tomorrow)

 

What We Need & What You Get

The idea is simple. When ever you buy one of our stylish hats, we will donate one to a child and provide a needed educaiton for one child in need throughout the world . For our Alaska communities, for each hat that is sold, we will also be providing one child with a suicide prvention education-an opportunity to say YES to Life.

The hats themselves are 100% yak wool with a full fleece lining, with a quality knit weave. Hats come in Black, Grey, and Pink. 

The money that is raised here will be used for our first "hat drop" to a rural community in Alaska. During this hat drop we will be offering a suicide prevention education to the young people of that community. 

The Impact

We work with proven and established organizations to get the hats (and suicide prevention education) to the children in most need. 

Children we are reaching out to:

Alaska Rural Communities. 

Refugee Camps

Homeless Shelters

Disaster Relief

Impovershed Communities

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Share this campaign with as many people you know!!!

story:
As a young man of God i acknowledge that my generation of young adults are not like the older generations before us. Even as Christians there is just something different. I call that The Rough The Rugged The Righteous generation. This clothing line is just a start to a bigger vision. 


Triple RRR is going to change the culture we live in today. With a old but new mindset of unconditional love. This has to happen but it will start with fashion because it is the most influential part of culture today. You have to "LOOK THE PART" in order to be fully accepted but we will show that the outside does not depict who we are on the inside.

Colossians 3:11-12

11 Here there is no Gentile or Jew, circumcised or uncircumcised,barbarian, Scythian, slave or free, but Christ is all, and is in all.

12 Therefore, as God’s chosen people, holy and dearly loved, clothe yourselves with compassion, kindness, humility,gentleness and patience.

With the clothing line, it will represent the both Ups and Downs in our lives because we all have them. It will also be a staple of faith, hope, and positivity even in those dark moments. 


AND EVEN IF YOU CAN NOT DONATE, YOU WILL BE HELPING US BY SHARING THIS AND STAYING UPDATED WITH US AND FOLLOWING US  AS WE SEE THE VISION THROUGH.
story_txt: As a young man of God i acknowledge that my generation of young adults are not like the older generations before us. Even as Christians there is just something different. I call that The Rough The Rugged The Righteous generation. This clothing line is just a start to a bigger vision. Triple RRR is going to change the culture we live in today. With a old but new mindset of unconditional love. This has to happen but it will start with fashion because it is the most influential part of culture today. You have to "LOOK THE PART" in order to be fully accepted but we will show that the outside does not depict who we are on the inside.Colossians 3:11-1211 Here there is no Gentile or Jew, circumcised or uncircumcised,barbarian, Scythian, slave or free, but Christ is all, and is in all.12 Therefore, as God’s chosen people, holy and dearly loved, clothe yourselves with compassion, kindness, humility,gentleness and patience.With the clothing line, it will represent the both Ups and Downs in our lives because we all have them. It will also be a staple of faith, hope, and positivity even in those dark moments. AND EVEN IF YOU CAN NOT DONATE, YOU WILL BE HELPING US BY SHARING THIS AND STAYING UPDATED WITH US AND FOLLOWING US  AS WE SEE THE VISION THROUGH.

story:
My name is Belle McCluskey and I am the owner/designer of Boring Sidney Hats and Headdresses. I
make hats with a vintage flair, a sense of humor, and an often wicked edge, all wrapped up in
elegance.
I have been making headpiece for over 20 years, I got my start in the theatre at Montana State
University as an apprentice milliner. After she left I took over as the theatres hatmaker, and spent
many years making hats for theatre, ballets, and musicials.
After several years I decided to branch out into independant millinery and haven't looked back.
Over the years I have been lucky enough to have hats featured in many magazines, blogs,
newspapers, runway shows, and TV shows. Including; Elle Accessory Magazine, Mirior Magazine,
Auxiliary Magazine, OffBeat Bride, The Wall Street Journal, Hello Kittys 35th Anniversary Runway
Show, and Martha Stewart TV.

The goal of my campaign is to help me get to the Milliners of Etsy's "Hats and Little Black Dresses"
Runway show in Three Oaks, Michigan on June 9th, 2013. This show will be attended by press and
celebrities alike, and for me to show a collection there could finally give me the boost that I need to
take my hat business to the next level.


My work has been admired and emmulated, but a lack of funds to do shows of this magnitude have
kept me from achieving what I know I can do, and making it as a true force in millinery fashion in the
United States, and worldwide.

Although I will need over $2500 to achieve my goal, I am putting in as much as I can on my own, at
$500-700, so my campaign goal is $2,000.
I will need travel expenses of approx $800-1,000, my supplies for creating my hats will run approx
$1,500, and I will need to ship 12 large hats to Chicago which will run approx $400.00.
If I don't meet my goal I will make a few less hats, and cut my stay in Chicago to 2 days instead of 3.

The line of hats that I am going to make for the show will be very haute couture headpiece in a
variety of materials, using advanced millinery technicques. My theme is "Deep Ocean". Having been
fascinated with the mysteries of the deepest depths of the ocean, both real and fictional, since I was a
child I am very excited to create a line of hats that will be influenced by and make reference to one of
the least understood and most fascinating places on our earth.
My line is going to be showstopping, and with all the press, important figures in fashion, and
celebrities that will be there it will give my business the visibility that it needs.

I know that not everyone will be able to contribute, but you can still help me by spreading the word,
and using the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you for considering contributing to my future, and for taking this ride with me!

Belle

story:
Our jewels are designed by Christian Gautier, he put all his energy and passion to create a line that is really unique … people do love them …YES, we are ready to go in the market …BUT …we need your support to produce the first 1000 pieces. JOIN US !


Making projects is a creator’s life …

Christian Gautier has been a creator all his life as a photographer and a designer. He has been dreaming for years to design jewels. It’s done. He took one year off to create a full collection, find the right producers, elaborate the marketing plan, design the web communication and promotion tools. All tests have shown his style is highly attractive. Our marketing and sales teamwork is ready to work and sell.

We’ve got a fashion creative product, we’ve got the channels, but we miss the first 1000 jewels to start selling on the web as well as in some fashion places.

That is where we need your help !


We are cloose to the goal …

The first sketches of the jewel collection were born less than one year ago. Christian made the first prototypes himself and then he created the 3D models which should be used as the matrices for production.  The collection includes 25 necklaces, earings, bracelets models, each being proposed in gold and silver plated versions.

As he started alone, Christian placed all his energy in the project, getting to learn several softs for 3D modelization, website and selling platform. Six month later, as prototypes where ready and satisfactory, external help was required to fine tune the marketing and communication strategy. That’s when we join 

him the three of us giving birth to very dynamic team, with a winning spirit.


Consumer group tests are made in Paris, Milan and Madrid with the help of friends in the business. 


They are quite positive:  60% of the women who saw and tried the jewels on declare they would buy them. 



Communication tools are set up in two months: the internet website is made under Christian artistic
direction and an active use of social network starts in parallel. Selling and distribution are envisaged through two complementary channels


-  a limited number of « design shops » selling and showing the jewels; they have been identified and confirmed their interest, as soon as products are available. 

-  a main « online  shop», www.christiangautierjewels.com, associated to a selling and distribution platform.


14 500 euros to help producing our first jewel stock  

We are ready to start online selling as soon as we get an average of 50 pieces of each of our 25 models. As we want handmade jewel, costs are rather high and we cannot afford them, after having self- financed all steps up to now. That is where we need your help.


We forecast starting on line selling in June in order to answer orders for the six next months. Our marketing tests have led us to evaluate quantities for each jewel and on the basis of our best producing opportunities cost of production will be 14 000 euros.

We really hope that Indiegogo will help our project succeed.


Indiegogo funders ! 

We will thank funders offering our jewels, from earings to necklaces.

story:
Available on our website now!

Visit www.derivecollection.com

 



We've designed the jacket to be fully reversible with 2 style contrast.
Rugged black on the outside and sporty cool on the inside.


Spend smartly, get 2 styles by paying the price for 1.

Most heating jackets use carbon fibres, ours uses Graphene, Nobel prize winning one atom thick wonder material. This material is not only the thinnest (gfx: only one-atom thick) but also the strongest material (200times stronger than steel) known to man. Proof that graphene is also an excellent conductor of heat and electricity.

 

Which is why, we have produced graphene based ink, which can be printed, wash, heated, wrinkled, and twisted without damaging the circuit!

 





We've also programmed it to operate on 3 different temperature levels so you can be fully in control of the temperature at your fingertips.

The heating pad of the jacket can be heated up to 40°C, 50°C, 60°C. The jacket should be around  45°C-50°C when wearing, depending on the external factors (e.g. surrounding environment temperature, wearing with the zip opened or zip up, etc).

story:
MY STORY

My name is Earvin Hughes and I'm from Ponchatoula, LA.  I have been working in staffing for over 7 years.  I created my D.O.S.E (Defying the Ordinary Striving for Extraordinary) brand in 2015 with my staffing company, D.O.S.E Virtual Affiliate Staffing, LLC.

I started this campaign D.O.S.E TEES as a creative idea to raise funds for my staffing company. I also wanted to put out positive vibes to encourage all builders and creators, whether you are thinking about starting an idea or currently putting action behind your idea, to keep pushing towards your goals.

Purchasing a t-shirt from my store will help with the operating expenses for my staffing company and will help me offer better more efficient services to get the underserved back working.  Creating more employment opportunities will help address some of the issues plaguing a lot of our communities and I want to be an advocate for the people seeking those opportunities.

 

My goal is to raise $20,000 in 60 days.  That is 1,000 t-shirts!!

I have 38 products in my store and I'm selling shirts for kids, men, and women.  None of my inventory in my store is over $20! I will keep my backers updated on my progress via my instagram page @dosevirtualstaffing.  Who knows maybe you are looking for a job and I can help you. If your business needs help with staffing I could assist you as well.

I need everyone to spread the word!!! Even if you don't purchase a shirt or donate, share my store on your social media networks.  I would greatly appreciate the support!!

 

I know it may be challenging to get buy-in for this campaign, but I'm really doing something positive.  I'm partnering with local organizations to speak to the youth that are preparing to enter the workforce.  You can be a contributing factor for me to increase my reach and to help more people.

 

GET THE WORD OUT!!!  YOU CAN SUPPORT ME BY BUYING A SHIRT OR DONATING DIRECTLY TO THIS CAMPAIGN!!

story:
Compact bags that keep you agile — anywhere, anytime.

 

Our new Rolltop and Crossbody bags are built for journeys where you need to stay mobile, streamlined, and ready to move at a moment's notice.

They're for you if:

  • You want to carry less, and carry it well.
  • You prefer to stay light on your feet. 
  • You handle a wide range of situations every day and need a bag that keeps you flexible.
  • You need super-quick access to your essentials, at all times. 
  • You crave tools that boost your speed instead of slowing you down with unnecessary straps and buckles.
  • You value precision-engineered, life-proof components and construction.

When we first dreamed up Minaal in the hazy days of 2007, our focus was on making thoughtful, reliable bags for long-haul travel. We figured: “even if nobody else likes these, at least we'll have our ultimate bag to use forever.” But some people did like them. Here's what they said:

 

Making the best bags for long-haul, carry-on travel is still at the core of our mission. But as the years passed, we also noticed a serious lack of options for people whose goal isn't always “fit the most possible stuff into a carry-on bag.”

We heard repeatedly from people who prefer to pack light, stay flexible, and glide effortlessly through crowded spaces.

You told us you were frustrated with the existing options. You were stuck with your unwieldy satchel. Or your fashionable but flimsy tote bag. Or that ugly yet disconcertingly seductive fanny pack from the 80s.

You wanted something that offered the same quality and qualities as our existing gear — the same high-end components and emphasis on efficient movement. But you wanted it to be designed specifically for frequent access, whether on a cycle commute or a long-haul flight.

You asked for bags that would help you organise your essentials, stay agile, and move as efficiently as possible from A to B.

We listened. And we made those bags.

Compact. Convenient.

 

The Minaal Rolltop is a compact bag for everyday use, and it also functions as a streamlined, easy-access bag for long-haul journeys. It's particularly ideal for short sprints where speed and convenience are your top priorities. It helps you stay burden-free and efficient as you glide from airport to café to meeting and back again.

Whether you’re cycling to work with your laptop, or cutting through crowds at rush hour, you need a bag that keeps the journey smooth. The Rolltop’s classic top-loading design — combined with its unique quick-access, full-length front zipper, and multiple stash pockets — keep your gear accessible on the move.

As well as taking care of your stuff, the Rolltop takes care of you: the EVA foam straps, padded carry handle, and custom-molded foam back panel make every step (or pedal) that little bit easier.

 

At 15L, the Rolltop packs surprising capacity into a minimalist silhouette. It carries up to a 15” device in a protective, suspended neoprene sleeve; its backpack straps can be hidden at a moment's notice; and its integrated secret pockets keep your wallet or passport safe in transit.

 

 

Instant access, zero bulk.

The Minaal Crossbody is built for speed and flexibility. It gives you instant access to the tools you need — no matter where your day takes you.

It's the bag for situations where you don't want to wear a bag. It's for cycling, snowsports, crowded trams, music festivals, exploring a hilly city on a hot day, and meandering along the beach at sunset with your favourite dog or fellow human.

As well as being an urban 'go' bag, the 2L Crossbody functions as an ultra-portable cabin bag on flights, giving you easier access to your gear and a sneaky amount of extra capacity. After all, when's the last time you saw a gate agent weigh a crossbody bag?

 

 

The Crossbody is the ultimate in hands-free accessibility, with the flexibility to wear across your chest or back, and plenty of internal organisation to keep your smalls on lock (yes that is a new phrase, and yes you may use it ironically).

 

 

What fits inside the Crossbody? Here are a few examples:

  • Kindle Paperwhite ✓ 
  • Sony A7 mirrorless camera ✓ 
  • iPhone XR ✓ 
  • iPhone X ✓ 
  • Samsung Galaxy S9+ ✓ 
  • Samsung Galaxy S10 ✓ 
  • Google Pixel 3 XL ✓ 
  • Passport ✓ 
  • Large banana (within reason — don't sue us when you hear about the Rhino Horn Plantain) ✓

What fits inside the Crossbody's secret pocket?

  • Credit cards ✓
  • Cash ✓
  • Keys (within reason, c'mon guys) ✓
  • USB sticks ✓
  • Personal items ✓
  • Very personal items ✓ (we think?!)
  • Diamonds ✓

 

Why we started Minaal

In 2007, when we first got excited about the vague idea of “starting a travel gear company,” we didn't really know what that meant. We had weird, non-travel-related jobs. We kept blowing any money we saved — on trips to Vietnam and Paraguay. We didn't even have a garage that could later feature in the story of our humble beginnings.

We just knew one thing. We couldn't find a professional-looking backpack specifically tailored to long-haul, minimalist, one-bag travel. All the existing options were either the wrong size, too suitcase-y, or simply not durable enough to go the distance.

The original Minaal Carry-on — which we launched in 2013 — was an attempt to change that status quo and kick off a Travel Revolution (albeit a bloodless one).

 

The support you gave us during our first crowdfunding campaign — and the incredible amount of discerning feedback and detailed feature requests you've given us since — is what allowed us to keep fighting the War on Dangle and continue making thoughtful, carefully-crafted gear.

Listening to you over the years has also helped us define who we are, why we're here, and what it should mean to be part of the Minaal community. It helped us realise things like:

1) You can be “at home” everywhere. We're making tools for a world where people change locations, jobs, cities – and countries – at will.

2) Great products put the user first, second, and third. We prioritise the experience of actually using our products. We have no outside investors or arbitrary fashion cycles to please. If it's not a joy to use, we won't release it – because we won't use it ourselves.

3) Quality saves money – and the environment. We live in a world where products are increasingly disposable. We make tools that are indispensable, not disposable.  Both from a financial and environmental perspective, the least expensive bag is the one you use the longest.

How we designed these bags

 

 

We only ever make gear that we think will be genuinely useful in a way that we — and others — actually care about.

For that reason, every single one of our designs starts with listening. It often takes several years of listening — and asking questions, and testing out ideas — to be sure we're onto something. The design process for the Rolltop and Crossbody began in 2017.

Since then we've been endlessly brainstorming, sketching, prototyping, and causing thousands of people around the world to wonder why New Zealanders compulsively touch the bags of passersby (it's called fabric research, Steve, and that restraining order was really uncalled for). 

Here are a few visuals of that process:

 

To repeat what we said during our last campaign: if you jump on this Indiegogo project, you're part of the family. We want to hear from you in good times and bad. We want to hear what you're up to, where you're headed, and we want to design gear that you want to carry.

(If you can't read Japanese, and you're not currently sitting next to a helpful Japanese stranger, feel free to skip the following section.)

For our friends in Japan:

日々の生活や旅行中でもモノに縛られず、行きたい場所に行き、会いたい人に会う

 

 

日本のバッグ愛好家の皆さん、こんにちわ！ 

Minaal創業者の一人であるJimmyは2年間前に生活の拠点を東京に移し、企画段階から常に日本のことを視野に入れながら今回のバッグのデザインを進めてきました。

毎日よく移動する人、混雑した電車での通勤をする人、PCを持ってカフェに通う人、休みは国内を旅する人、海外出張が多い人、または他拠点生活をしている人・・。 日本の多様なライフスタイルが、新しいバッグへのアイデアを生み出してくれました。 

 

  • 荷物はより少ないものだけを、より賢く持ち歩きたい人
  • 「Less is More」という生き方に共感できる人
  • 移動が多く、どんな混雑した状況でも邪魔にならないバッグが必要な人
  • 暮らすように旅をしている人
  • パソコン等の必需品に早く簡単にアクセスできるバッグを探している人
  • デザインと耐久性のバランスを求める人

 

より早く、よりミニマルに動きたいあなたに愛用してもらえることを願い、私達はこのバッグを作りました。 共感いただける方は、是非このプロジェクトに参加してもらえると嬉しいです。

今あなたがいる場所と、次の目的地との距離が少しでも近づきますように。

 

Minaal ロールトップ

  • 容量：15L 
  • 重量：890g 
  • サイズ：幅32 x 奥行き12 x 高さ(ロール時) 48cm  
  • 高さ(ロール無し)：56cm 
  • トップの幅：41cm 
  • 奥行き : 中身がない状態：10cm、中身がある状態：14cm、フラットな状態 : ~5cm  


Minaal クロスボディ

  • 容量：2L 
  • 重量：290g 
  • サイズ：幅30 x 奥行き5 x 高さ15cm

In our most recent crowdfunding campaign three years ago, we attracted (and fell just a little in love with) nearly 2,500 backers from 66 countries. Despite shipping to far-flung regions like Nokia, Finland, and Mosgiel, New Zealand, we fulfilled the campaign on time (or in many cases, ahead of schedule).

That said, please be aware: we put a huge amount of energy and care into the design, manufacturing and fulfillment processes, and would never compromise on quality just to beat a delivery date.

We plan on shipping all Indiegogo rewards by the end of November 2019.

After delivering multiple crowdfunding campaigns on-time, we're fully set up to accommodate large orders. So if you'd like to get your hands on 10+ bags — for your company swag, or your bag-loving Sicilian dynasty — we can make that happen. Message us for details!

We can't emphasise enough how ridiculously helpful people have been since we set out. To our previous backers, our users, our friends, and everyone else we nagged for advice or support along the way — THANK YOU.

It's worth saying again: we care a lot – like, possibly an unhealthy amount – about your experience using the tools we make. These bags were borne from the generous, extensive feedback we received from many of you over the years. We designed them to last for as long as humanly possible. “Planned obsolescence” is really not our jam.

Real talk: there are alternatives out there, many of them good. If they suit your life or your use case better, we'd be stoked to hear you've found a perfect fit. For us, this isn't about making sales at any cost. It's about making bags that we love using so much, we're compelled to share them with other people.

For us, minimalism isn't just about having fewer things. It's about having the right things. And remember – the cheapest bag, the one that's least draining on the environment? It's the one you use the longest. 

Still have questions? Check out our FAQ below.

 

FAQ

-----

Product

What are the bags' weights & dimensions?

Here are the provisional specs. For more info, check out the 'key features' graphics further up the page.

Rolltop: 

  • Weight = 890g / 1.96lb
  • Dimensions = 32 x 12 x 48cm / 12.6 x 4.7 x 18.9in (rolled)

Crossbody: 

  • Weight = 290g / 0.65lb
  • Dimensions = 30 x 5 x 15cm / 11.8 x 2 x 5.9in

Will the Rolltop fit my laptop/tablet?

The Rolltop's suspended neoprene device sleeve fits a 15” Macbook Pro or smaller. Larger laptops may fit inside the bag itself, but would need their own case. If in doubt, drop us a line and we'll help you figure it out! 

Will you be offering other colours?

Right now, we don't have plans to release a new colour during the campaign. Introducing colours introduces operational complexity and as always, our absolute priority is hitting our delivery deadline. We're constantly evaluating options and if we get to a point where the complexity doesn't risk derailing the timeline, we'll consider colours again. 

Where are these bags made?

They're designed in New Zealand and on the road, and built in Vietnam, using high-end components from Germany, Taiwan, and the United States, among others. 

Will these bags fit my height/build?

The adjustable harness (of the Rolltop) and strap (of the Crossbody) are designed to fit a wide range of people. In some of the photos further up the page, we've added captions showing the height and weight of the model. That should give you an idea, but message us if you have any doubts! 

Do you offer bulk discounts?

Yes! We're fully set up to accommodate bulk orders. If you're interested, get in touch with us directly at feedback [at] minaal [dot] com. 

Shipping

Which countries do you ship to?

In addition to a US-based warehouse for US orders, we ship worldwide via various carriers from our international distribution hub in Hong Kong. 

When will I receive my gear?

We're aiming to ship all Indiegogo rewards before the end of November. We'll be using a variety of carriers to reach different parts of the world — once your gear has shipped, we'll send you a tracking number. 

How did you decide on your estimated delivery date?

Some campaigns set unrealistically short delivery dates to attract more sales. We never make compromises on design, manufacturing or fulfillment in order to rush a delivery date. Our bags are slow-cooked, carefully tested for quality, and only dished up to you when they're ready. Our two previous crowdfunding campaigns met or beat their delivery deadlines after that same process.

Customs

Will there be any delays/fees?

Crowdfunding campaigns regularly fulfill orders worldwide, and we've done it twice ourselves. In saying that, we don't claim to have intimate customs knowledge of the entire world. We can't guarantee you won't experience delays or be charged import duties. We will do everything we possible can, however, to minimise the risk of this happening. 

Returns

Do you offer them?

We don't offer Change-of-Mind returns on Indiegogo perks. At its core, Indiegogo is about backing ambitious projects and helping them get off the ground before they're fully formed. In return, backers get a pre-sale price. However – you ARE able to cancel your pledge at any point until your reward is shipped. 

Lifetime warranty 

Do you provide one?

Absolutely! All our gear comes with a lifetime warranty against defects — and these bags are no exception. 

Miscellaneous

I already have a Carry-on 2.0 and Daily. Do I need these new bags?

The Carry-on 2.0 and Daily are built primarily for travellers who need to stay professional on the move. The Rolltop and Crossbody have similar capabilities, but an even more streamlined feel: they're more compact, and ideal for day-to-day situations where all you need are your essentials.

How can I get these delivered to someone as a gift?

Yes! It's just a matter of submitting the right shipping address. If in doubt, message us so we can work out the specifics.  

I'm travelling, can I send my bag(s) to X destination?

Sure, just drop us a line and we can figure something out :)

Is the Crossbody essentially a new-age fanny pack?

 Yes, also known in parts of the Southern Hemisphere as a bum bag.

Who — or what — is Minaal?

 We started off as two guys from New Zealand — with no real business credentials or manufacturing experience whatsoever — who were frustrated by the lack of great travel bags. So, in 2013, we launched a crowdfunding campaign with the aim of making that bag. Thanks to you — our incredible backers — our original Carry-on took off. Since then, we've been building a company dedicated to creating gear that makes you feel at home everywhere. 

If life is “a brief crack of light between two eternities of darkness,” why bother backing your Indiegogo campaign?

Email us.
story_txt:
Compact bags that keep you agile — anywhere, anytime. Our new Rolltop and Crossbody bags are built for journeys where you need to stay mobile, streamlined, and ready to move at a moment's notice.They're for you if:
You want to carry less, and carry it well.
You prefer to stay light on your feet. 
You handle a wide range of situations every day and need a bag that keeps you flexible.
You need super-quick access to your essentials, at all times. 
You crave tools that boost your speed instead of slowing you down with unnecessary straps and buckles.
You value precision-engineered, life-proof components and construction.
  When we first dreamed up Minaal in the hazy days of 2007, our focus was on making thoughtful, reliable bags for long-haul travel. We figured: “even if nobody else likes these, at least we'll have our ultimate bag to use forever.” But some people did like them. Here's what they said:  Making the best bags for long-haul, carry-on travel is still at the core of our mission. But as the years passed, we also noticed a serious lack of options for people whose goal isn't always “fit the most possible stuff into a carry-on bag.”We heard repeatedly from people who prefer to pack light, stay flexible, and glide effortlessly through crowded spaces.You told us you were frustrated with the existing options. You were stuck with your unwieldy satchel. Or your fashionable but flimsy tote bag. Or that ugly yet disconcertingly seductive fanny pack from the 80s.You wanted something that offered the same quality and qualities as our existing gear — the same high-end components and emphasis on efficient movement. But you wanted it to be designed specifically for frequent access, whether on a cycle commute or a long-haul flight.You asked for bags that would help you organise your essentials, stay agile, and move as efficiently as possible from A to B.We listened. And we made those bags. 
 Compact. Convenient. The Minaal Rolltop is a compact bag for everyday use, and it also functions as a streamlined, easy-access bag for long-haul journeys. It's particularly ideal for short sprints where speed and convenience are your top priorities. It helps you stay burden-free and efficient as you glide from airport to café to meeting and back again.Whether you’re cycling to work with your laptop, or cutting through crowds at rush hour, you need a bag that keeps the journey smooth. The Rolltop’s classic top-loading design — combined with its unique quick-access, full-length front zipper, and multiple stash pockets — keep your gear accessible on the move.As well as taking care of your stuff, the Rolltop takes care of you: the EVA foam straps, padded carry handle, and custom-molded foam back panel make every step (or pedal) that little bit easier. At 15L, the Rolltop packs surprising capacity into a minimalist silhouette. It carries up to a 15” device in a protective, suspended neoprene sleeve; its backpack straps can be hidden at a moment's notice; and its integrated secret pockets keep your wallet or passport safe in transit. 
 Ben's height: 190cm / 6'3" || Ben's weight: 79kg / 175lb
 Eva's height: 157cm / 5'2" || Eva's weight: 50kg / 110lb
 The Rolltop's neoprene device sleeve is suspended away from the edges of the bag, protecting your laptop from drops.
 When you need a little more formality, hide the harness in a few seconds...
 ...and transition to your Rolltop's ultra-comfy EVA-foam handle.
 Want to access your tools on the move? No need to unroll the top flap...
 ...but the hidden pockets are there whenever you want to prioritise security.
 The German-engineered, secure magnetic fasteners of the rolltop entry complement a full-length front zip and two stash pockets – each with its own nested, secure pocket within.
 A bag designed for your essentials... with room for some cheeky extras.
 
  Instant access, zero bulk.The Minaal Crossbody is built for speed and flexibility. It gives you instant access to the tools you need — no matter where your day takes you.It's the bag for situations where you don't want to wear a bag. It's for cycling, snowsports, crowded trams, music festivals, exploring a hilly city on a hot day, and meandering along the beach at sunset with your favourite dog or fellow human.As well as being an urban 'go' bag, the 2L Crossbody functions as an ultra-portable cabin bag on flights, giving you easier access to your gear and a sneaky amount of extra capacity. After all, when's the last time you saw a gate agent weigh a crossbody bag?  The Crossbody is the ultimate in hands-free accessibility, with the flexibility to wear across your chest or back, and plenty of internal organisation to keep your smalls on lock (yes that is a new phrase, and yes you may use it ironically). 
 Eva's height: 157cm / 5'2" || Eva's weight: 50kg / 110lb
 Ben's height: 190cm / 6'3" || Ben's weight: 79kg / 175lb
 The accessibility and ultralight carry weight of the Crossbody set it apart from backpacks, duffels, and totes.
 The Crossbody’s internal organisation lets you access your essentials quickly and efficiently. What fits inside the Crossbody? Here are a few examples:
Kindle Paperwhite ✓ 
Sony A7 mirrorless camera ✓ 
iPhone XR ✓ 
iPhone X ✓ 
Samsung Galaxy S9+ ✓ 
Samsung Galaxy S10 ✓ 
Google Pixel 3 XL ✓ 
Passport ✓ 
Large banana (within reason — don't sue us when you hear about the Rhino Horn Plantain) ✓
Stretch-fabric connection wings give you a better fit, and the Crossbody's position and size help avoid the uncomfortable sweat that backpacks can cause.
 Eva's height: 157cm / 5'2" || Eva's weight: 50kg / 110lb
 Keep your valuables safely within your field of vision in crowded spaces, and use the secret pocket for your credit cards, cash, or keys.
 What fits inside the Crossbody's secret pocket?
Credit cards ✓
Cash ✓
Keys (within reason, c'mon guys) ✓
USB sticks ✓
Personal items ✓
Very personal items ✓ (we think?!)
Diamonds ✓
The custom-molded foam back panel balances durability with soft handfeel, and the quality of the other components — including a magnetic quick-release buckle — mean the Crossbody will be with you for a lifetime.
   Why we started MinaalIn 2007, when we first got excited about the vague idea of “starting a travel gear company,” we didn't really know what that meant. We had weird, non-travel-related jobs. We kept blowing any money we saved — on trips to Vietnam and Paraguay. We didn't even have a garage that could later feature in the story of our humble beginnings.We just knew one thing. We couldn't find a professional-looking backpack specifically tailored to long-haul, minimalist, one-bag travel. All the existing options were either the wrong size, too suitcase-y, or simply not durable enough to go the distance.The original Minaal Carry-on — which we launched in 2013 — was an attempt to change that status quo and kick off a Travel Revolution (albeit a bloodless one).  The support you gave us during our first crowdfunding campaign — and the incredible amount of discerning feedback and detailed feature requests you've given us since — is what allowed us to keep fighting the War on Dangle and continue making thoughtful, carefully-crafted gear.Listening to you over the years has also helped us define who we are, why we're here, and what it should mean to be part of the Minaal community. It helped us realise things like:1) You can be “at home” everywhere. We're making tools for a world where people change locations, jobs, cities – and countries – at will.2) Great products put the user first, second, and third. We prioritise the experience of actually using our products. We have no outside investors or arbitrary fashion cycles to please. If it's not a joy to use, we won't release it – because we won't use it ourselves.3) Quality saves money – and the environment. We live in a world where products are increasingly disposable. We make tools that are indispensable, not disposable.  Both from a financial and environmental perspective, the least expensive bag is the one you use the longest.How we designed these bags Not all buckles are created equal. The less equal ones, Jimmy cruelly ignores. We only ever make gear that we think will be genuinely useful in a way that we — and others — actually care about.For that reason, every single one of our designs starts with listening. It often takes several years of listening — and asking questions, and testing out ideas — to be sure we're onto something. The design process for the Rolltop and Crossbody began in 2017. Since then we've been endlessly brainstorming, sketching, prototyping, and causing thousands of people around the world to wonder why New Zealanders compulsively touch the bags of passersby (it's called fabric research, Steve, and that restraining order was really uncalled for). Here are a few visuals of that process:A CNC machine crafts a buckle mold. The water injection is to prevent us from being engulfed in flames. Thank you, water.
 Strength testing. Some sources report that Doug was scared by the noise and Jimmy wasn’t.
 If anyone needs any high-end drill bits, call Doug on [number redacted]!
 Buckle Mordor.
At last, we've created prototypes that we're very, very excited about. This is a behind-the-scenes shot of us filming the video. See also: flagrant topknot. To repeat what we said during our last campaign: if you jump on this Indiegogo project, you're part of the family. We want to hear from you in good times and bad. We want to hear what you're up to, where you're headed, and we want to design gear that you want to carry.  (If you can't read Japanese, and you're not currently sitting next to a helpful Japanese stranger, feel free to skip the following section.)For our friends in Japan:日々の生活や旅行中でもモノに縛られず、行きたい場所に行き、会いたい人に会う   日本のバッグ愛好家の皆さん、こんにちわ！ Minaal創業者の一人であるJimmyは2年間前に生活の拠点を東京に移し、企画段階から常に日本のことを視野に入れながら今回のバッグのデザインを進めてきました。毎日よく移動する人、混雑した電車での通勤をする人、PCを持ってカフェに通う人、休みは国内を旅する人、海外出張が多い人、または他拠点生活をしている人・・。 日本の多様なライフスタイルが、新しいバッグへのアイデアを生み出してくれました。  
荷物はより少ないものだけを、より賢く持ち歩きたい人
「Less is More」という生き方に共感できる人
移動が多く、どんな混雑した状況でも邪魔にならないバッグが必要な人
暮らすように旅をしている人
パソコン等の必需品に早く簡単にアクセスできるバッグを探している人
デザインと耐久性のバランスを求める人
 より早く、よりミニマルに動きたいあなたに愛用してもらえることを願い、私達はこのバッグを作りました。 共感いただける方は、是非このプロジェクトに参加してもらえると嬉しいです。今あなたがいる場所と、次の目的地との距離が少しでも近づきますように。  Minaal ロールトップ
容量：15L 
重量：890g 
サイズ：幅32 x 奥行き12 x 高さ(ロール時) 48cm  
高さ(ロール無し)：56cm 
トップの幅：41cm 
奥行き : 中身がない状態：10cm、中身がある状態：14cm、フラットな状態 : ~5cm  
Minaal クロスボディ
容量：2L 
重量：290g 
サイズ：幅30 x 奥行き5 x 高さ15cm
 In our most recent crowdfunding campaign three years ago, we attracted (and fell just a little in love with) nearly 2,500 backers from 66 countries. Despite shipping to far-flung regions like Nokia, Finland, and Mosgiel, New Zealand, we fulfilled the campaign on time (or in many cases, ahead of schedule).That said, please be aware: we put a huge amount of energy and care into the design, manufacturing and fulfillment processes, and would never compromise on quality just to beat a delivery date.We plan on shipping all Indiegogo rewards by the end of November 2019.After delivering multiple crowdfunding campaigns on-time, we're fully set up to accommodate large orders. So if you'd like to get your hands on 10+ bags — for your company swag, or your bag-loving Sicilian dynasty — we can make that happen. Message us for details!We can't emphasise enough how ridiculously helpful people have been since we set out. To our previous backers, our users, our friends, and everyone else we nagged for advice or support along the way — THANK YOU.It's worth saying again: we care a lot – like, possibly an unhealthy amount – about your experience using the tools we make. These bags were borne from the generous, extensive feedback we received from many of you over the years. We designed them to last for as long as humanly possible. “Planned obsolescence” is really not our jam.Real talk: there are alternatives out there, many of them good. If they suit your life or your use case better, we'd be stoked to hear you've found a perfect fit. For us, this isn't about making sales at any cost. It's about making bags that we love using so much, we're compelled to share them with other people.For us, minimalism isn't just about having fewer things. It's about having the right things. And remember – the cheapest bag, the one that's least draining on the environment? It's the one you use the longest.   Still have questions? story:
Our Shred Boost sunglasses are now available at shredoptics.com

 

 

All too often, sunglasses designed for active endeavors make compromises. Whether through their frame design, lens quality, or the materials they use, ordinary shades sacrifice performance to enhance style or make an extra buck. Simply put, the technology found in the world’s best optics has not been available in shades built for life in motion—until now.

After struggling to find sunglasses that truly met our needs, we created them. Our Shred Boost sunglasses offer unrivaled clarity, contrast, and performance in optics built to endure the great outdoors. Made in Italy and paired with the finest lenses from Japan, these shades showcase a crisp appearance and unparalleled craftsmanship. With your help, we stand to create a new standard in optics, blending premium technology with designs that are as stylish as they are durable.

 

Our passion runs deep—and so does our experience. Shred is the brainchild of Ted Ligety and Carlo Salmini. In addition to snagging two Olympic gold medals in alpine skiing, Ted is a five-time World Champ. Carlo is a materials engineer, avid skier and biker, and a graduate of the MIT Sloan School of Management. Throughout the past ten years, Ted and Carlo have attained a slew of patents for Shred’s helmets, goggles, and protective gear. These products have also earned no shortage of accolades and a loyal following among fans and athletes.  

 

 

   

 

 

Stop. Take a minute to name all of the brands you can think of that make sunglasses for an active lifestyle. There’s a good chance that every single brand you named uses either CR-39 or polycarbonate lenses. Although eighty percent of the world’s shades feature these lens materials, they are deeply flawed. Polycarbonate lenses are durable but, due to being injection molded, feature inconsistencies that create significant optical distortion. Despite having good optical properties, CR-39 is especially brittle and offers extremely poor impact resistance.

Rather than embracing the status quo, we moved beyond it. In lieu of polycarbonate or CR-39 lenses, we use liquid-cast urethane lenses of the highest optical grade, which also offer the best impact resistance and durability. By liquid casting our lenses in glass molds, we ensure they’re free of distortion. In addition to offering crystal clear vision, urethane lenses are exceptionally light and provide excellent scratch and shatter resistance. Rather than making compromises, our lenses offer unrivaled performance.

The use of these lenses places us in elite company. Shred and a handful of other brands use high-grade urethane. These other brands are synonymous with excellence in optic precision and quality. Yet none of these other brands has applied this technology to products designed for an active lifestyle. We’re addressing this need, crafting frames that deliver fresh style and plenty of performance while also featuring some of the finest lenses in the world.

 

It wasn’t enough to make our lenses free of distortion. We also wanted them to enhance image definition, contrast, and the vividness of colors. Driven by this desire, we created our Contrast Boosting Lens (CBL) technology.

For the CBL technology used in our sunglasses, we developed a dye that is optimized for compatibility and performance with the high-grade urethane used to make our lenses. Especially versatile, this lens tint makes specific color ranges warmer and richer to ensure our sunglasses can truly handle all terrain and conditions.

By making the colors and details that truly matter pop, our lenses amplify your experience and enable you to see nuances that would otherwise escape detection with a traditional lens. This stands to boost your confidence, safety, and ability to enjoy the moment. Thanks to CBL, you can see more—and see better.

One of the greatest ways to improve the comfort of a pair of sunglasses is to reduce its weight. Guided by this belief, we designed our NoWeight frames to be especially light. These frames use minimal material while maximizing stability and performance.

The exterior of our frames provides a clean, streamlined appearance while on the frame’s interior sides, we’ve reduced the material used in areas subject to minimal stress and reinforced target areas for maximum durability. This significantly reduces the weight of our frames, and allows them to be extremely thin and flexible.

And to lessen CO2 emissions, we make our frames with a specially formulated polyamide that is partially bio-based, as fifty-four percent of this polymer’s raw material comes from renewable resources (measured in accordance with the ASTM D6866 standard).

GRIP-ON™ pads on the nose and temple tips further enhance comfort and ensure the frames stay in place while you’re in motion.

 

We offer our Shred Boost sunglasses in three frame designs:

Armed with a timeless style, the Belushki is at ease on the peaks and in the streets. This design features accents on the front of the frame and lenses with a base six curve, which provide a flatter look.

 

Bold and confident, the Provocator cradles the contours of your face for a fresh blend of style and performance. Its base eight curve lenses provide the frames with a wrap-around design, offering a streamlined appearance and additional protection. We also offer the Provocator Airflow, which incorporates a thin vent into the outer edge of each lens to maximize ventilation. This design prevents the lenses from fogging when you’re especially active. The Provocator Airflow features CBL lenses and also comes with a bonus clear, non-CBL lens.

 

With a slightly larger lens and frame than the Belushki, the Stomp infuses a classic design with modern performance. Its base six curve lenses provide the frame with a flatter appearance.

 

We offer a range of lens treatments to better meet your needs—and budget. Each model is available in polarized and non-polarized versions, as well as with mirrored and non-mirrored lenses. And for a crisp appearance and timeless style, all of our sunglasses sport matte black frames. 

Shred polarized lenses filter out scattered and reflected light to minimize glare while further enhancing contrast and your ability to perceive color. This stands to improve comfort by reducing strain on your eyes—even during the brightest days of summer. For those searching for additional style, mirrored lenses provide an appearance that’s both bold and timeless. 

To help ensure that their clarity stands the test of time, all of our lenses feature a permanent oleo and hydrophobic protective treatment on the inside of the lens to make its surface water and grease repellent.

 

We’ve spent the past several years testing and refining our Shred Boost sunglasses. In addition to leveraging our knowledge and expertise, we’ve tapped a vast network of friends and team riders to ensure our shades reach their full potential.

 

Today, we’re turning to you and the Indiegogo community to help fuel innovation and bring these shades to market. As a small, independent company in an industry dominated by giants, your support is essential. Together, we can create a new standard in optics built for an active lifestyle.

Indiegogo allows us to directly connect with you and other kindred spirits and lets us focus on what truly matters. Rather than chasing our competitors, we’re committed to enhancing how you experience the outdoors. And by connecting with you directly, we can create unparalleled value, eliminating many of the costs associated with the traditional retail model.

 

Sometimes, what you don’t get is just as important as what you do. We designed the packaging for our sunglasses to minimize waste and maximize value for you, the consumer.

 

Throughout the past decade, Shred has carefully selected the partners that produce our products and then created strong and meaningful relationships with them. The factory in Italy that produces our frames is just thirty minutes from our office. Located in an area known for its rich tradition in manufacturing eyewear, our partner pairs an intense passion for design with the world’s best frame-building technology. This enables us to rapidly refine our sunglasses and continually monitor their quality, ensuring every pair is one-hundred percent on point and meets our exceptionally high standards. 

To ensure our lenses offer unrivaled clarity and precision, they’re crafted in the Kansai area of Japan. The country’s manufacturers are revered for their deep commitment to quality and their ability to provide on-time delivery, short lead times, and small-batch production. And within Japan’s rich history of innovation and craftsmanship, the factory that makes our lenses is a true leader in precision optics. Its ability to rapidly prototype lenses has been essential in fueling the progression at the heart of our Shred Boost sunglasses.

 

We’ve spent the past two years testing and refining our Shred Boost sunglasses and we’ll continue working relentlessly to get them to you. The project’s key milestones include: 

 

 

 

 

Whether you’re sharing your support for this project or simply want to learn more about Shred, please hit us up on social media. Here’s where you can find us:

 

 

   

For questions about this project, please first read the FAQ below. If you still have a question, we’d love to hear from you at info@shredoptics.com.

For press inquiries, please contact mike@shredoptics.com.

We’d like to thank our friends, family, and you—our backers—for making this project possible. May your days be filled with deep snow, bluebird skies, fresh loam, high fives, and whatever else trips your trigger.
