Our Shred Boost sunglasses are now available at shredoptics.com  All too often, sunglasses designed for active endeavors make compromises. Whether through their frame design, lens quality, or the materials they use, ordinary shades sacrifice performance to enhance style or make an extra buck. Simply put, the technology found in the world’s best optics has not been available in shades built for life in motion—until now.After struggling to find sunglasses that truly met our needs, we created them. Our Shred Boost sunglasses offer unrivaled clarity, contrast, and performance in optics built to endure the great outdoors. Made in Italy and paired with the finest lenses from Japan, these shades showcase a crisp appearance and unparalleled craftsmanship. With your help, we stand to create a new standard in optics, blending premium technology with designs that are as stylish as they are durable. Our passion runs deep—and so does our experience. Shred is the brainchild of Ted Ligety and Carlo Salmini. In addition to snagging two Olympic gold medals in alpine skiing, Ted is a five-time World Champ. Carlo is a materials engineer, avid skier and biker, and a graduate of the MIT Sloan School of Management. Throughout the past ten years, Ted and Carlo have attained a slew of patents for Shred’s helmets, goggles, and protective gear. These products have also earned no shortage of accolades and a loyal following among fans and athletes.         Stop. Take a minute to name all of the brands you can think of that make sunglasses for an active lifestyle. There’s a good chance that every single brand you named uses either CR-39 or polycarbonate lenses. Although eighty percent of the world’s shades feature these lens materials, they are deeply flawed. Polycarbonate lenses are durable but, due to being injection molded, feature inconsistencies that create significant optical distortion. Despite having good optical properties, CR-39 is especially brittle and offers extremely poor impact resistance.Rather than embracing the status quo, we moved beyond it. In lieu of polycarbonate or CR-39 lenses, we use liquid-cast urethane lenses of the highest optical grade, which also offer the best impact resistance and durability. By liquid casting our lenses in glass molds, we ensure they’re free of distortion. In addition to offering crystal clear vision, urethane lenses are exceptionally light and provide excellent scratch and shatter resistance. Rather than making compromises, our lenses offer unrivaled performance.The use of these lenses places us in elite company. Shred and a handful of other brands use high-grade urethane. These other brands are synonymous with excellence in optic precision and quality. Yet none of these other brands has applied this technology to products designed for an active lifestyle. We’re addressing this need, crafting frames that deliver fresh style and plenty of performance while also featuring some of the finest lenses in the world. It wasn’t enough to make our lenses free of distortion. We also wanted them to enhance image definition, contrast, and the vividness of colors. Driven by this desire, we created our Contrast Boosting Lens (CBL) technology.For the CBL technology used in our sunglasses, we developed a dye that is optimized for compatibility and performance with the high-grade urethane used to make our lenses. Especially versatile, this lens tint makes specific color ranges warmer and richer to ensure our sunglasses can truly handle all terrain and conditions.By making the colors and details that truly matter pop, our lenses amplify your experience and enable you to see nuances that would otherwise escape detection with a traditional lens. This stands to boost your confidence, safety, and ability to enjoy the moment. Thanks to CBL, you can see more—and see better.One of the greatest ways to improve the comfort of a pair of sunglasses is to reduce its weight. Guided by this belief, we designed our NoWeight frames to be especially light. These frames use minimal material while maximizing stability and performance.The exterior of our frames provides a clean, streamlined appearance while on the frame’s interior sides, we’ve reduced the material used in areas subject to minimal stress and reinforced target areas for maximum durability. This significantly reduces the weight of our frames, and allows them to be extremely thin and flexible.And to lessen CO2 emissions, we make our frames with a specially formulated polyamide that is partially bio-based, as fifty-four percent of this polymer’s raw material comes from renewable resources (measured in accordance with the ASTM D6866 standard).GRIP-ON™ pads on the nose and temple tips further enhance comfort and ensure the frames stay in place while you’re in motion. We offer our Shred Boost sunglasses in three frame designs:Armed with a timeless style, the Belushki is at ease on the peaks and in the streets. This design features accents on the front of the frame and lenses with a base six curve, which provide a flatter look. Bold and confident, the Provocator cradles the contours of your face for a fresh blend of style and performance. Its base eight curve lenses provide the frames with a wrap-around design, offering a streamlined appearance and additional protection. We also offer the Provocator Airflow, which incorporates a thin vent into the outer edge of each lens to maximize ventilation. This design prevents the lenses from fogging when you’re especially active. The Provocator Airflow features CBL lenses and also comes with a bonus clear, non-CBL lens. With a slightly larger lens and frame than the Belushki, the Stomp infuses a classic design with modern performance. Its base six curve lenses provide the frame with a flatter appearance. We offer a range of lens treatments to better meet your needs—and budget. Each model is available in polarized and non-polarized versions, as well as with mirrored and non-mirrored lenses. And for a crisp appearance and timeless style, all of our sunglasses sport matte black frames. Shred polarized lenses filter out scattered and reflected light to minimize glare while further enhancing contrast and your ability to perceive color. This stands to improve comfort by reducing strain on your eyes—even during the brightest days of summer. For those searching for additional style, mirrored lenses provide an appearance that’s both bold and timeless. To help ensure that their clarity stands the test of time, all of our lenses feature a permanent oleo and hydrophobic protective treatment on the inside of the lens to make its surface water and grease repellent. We’ve spent the past several years testing and refining our Shred Boost sunglasses. In addition to leveraging our knowledge and expertise, we’ve tapped a vast network of friends and team riders to ensure our shades reach their full potential. Today, we’re turning to you and the Indiegogo community to help fuel innovation and bring these shades to market. As a small, independent company in an industry dominated by giants, your support is essential. Together, we can create a new standard in optics built for an active lifestyle.Indiegogo allows us to directly connect with you and other kindred spirits and lets us focus on what truly matters. Rather than chasing our competitors, we’re committed to enhancing how you experience the outdoors. And by connecting with you directly, we can create unparalleled value, eliminating many of the costs associated with the traditional retail model. Sometimes, what you don’t get is just as important as what you do. We designed the packaging for our sunglasses to minimize waste and maximize value for you, the consumer. Throughout the past decade, Shred has carefully selected the partners that produce our products and then created strong and meaningful relationships with them. The factory in Italy that produces our frames is just thirty minutes from our office. Located in an area known for its rich tradition in manufacturing eyewear, our partner pairs an intense passion for design with the world’s best frame-building technology. This enables us to rapidly refine our sunglasses and continually monitor their quality, ensuring every pair is one-hundred percent on point and meets our exceptionally high standards. To ensure our lenses offer unrivaled clarity and precision, they’re crafted in the Kansai area of Japan. The country’s manufacturers are revered for their deep commitment to quality and their ability to provide on-time delivery, short lead times, and small-batch production. And within Japan’s rich history of innovation and craftsmanship, the factory that makes our lenses is a true leader in precision optics. Its ability to rapidly prototype lenses has been essential in fueling the progression at the heart of our Shred Boost sunglasses. As a proud member of 1% for the Planet, we’re part of a coalition of over 1,200 businesses that commit to donating financial support to environmental causes. Through our commitment to the organization, we donate one percent of all sales from our website and Indiegogo pledges to environmental initiatives. As part of this commitment, we support Protect Our Winters and its efforts to combat climate change and educate the public about its effects.
 
We’ve spent the past two years testing and refining our Shred Boost sunglasses and we’ll continue working relentlessly to get them to you. The project’s key milestones include:     Whether you’re sharing your support for this project or simply want to learn more about Shred, please hit us up on social media. Here’s where you can find us:         For questions about this project, please first read the FAQ below. If you still have a question, we’d love to hear from you at info@shredoptics.com.For press inquiries, please contact mike@shredoptics.com.We’d like to thank our friends, family, and you—our backers—for making this project possible. May your days be filled with deep snow, bluebird skies, fresh loam, high fives, and whatever else trips your trigger.

story:
Have you heard about the bags made from apples? We are the world's first luxury brand to use this amazing material and have created a bag with endless possibilities. Ethically made, using the highest quality components, a bag that is truly responsible and vegan. 

After a successful pre-launch, more than doubling our sales goal, we want to keep up the great offer. The new goal has been set as a chance for even more people to support us and continue to spread the word. Pieces are limited so order while you can and become an ambassador of happy genie. Thank you for all the support in helping us make luxury fashion ethical.
story_txt:
Have you heard about the bags made from apples? We are the world's first luxury brand to use this amazing material and have created a bag with endless possibilities. Ethically made, using the highest quality components, a bag that is truly responsible and vegan. 
After a successful pre-launch, more than doubling our sales goal, we want to keep up the great offer. The new goal has been set as a chance for even more people to support us and continue to spread the word. Pieces are limited so order while you can and become an ambassador of happy genie. Thank you for all the support in helping us make luxury fashion ethical.

story:
Each of us here at Peejamas is a parent who cares deeply about our children: their health, their well-being, their development and growth, and their future. For these very reasons, we came up with a product that we believe flips the script on conventional potty-training at night. 

Peejamas are a parents complete replacement to traditional nighttime potty-training methods (i.e. diapers). 

 Yep, time to party!

 

The Problems with Current Nighttime Potty-Training Options

Nighttime diapers are expensive - we're talking up to 2x more expensive than regular diapers. That's a lot of dough for young, cash-conscious couples to be throwing away every month. 

Washing your sheets gets exhausting. Any parent that has had to strip the sheets off their kids bed in the middle of the night to throw them in the wash knows that the struggle is real. Especially night after night... after night after night... You get it. 

Diapers add billions of pounds of waste to landfills each year. Not only are they a major contributor to total landfill waste, studies indicate that diapers can take up to 500 years to degrade!

Diapers can delay a child's learning! We all have our crutches we use, and kids are no different. Based on our super scientific research :), we strongly believe that when a child uses a diaper, they are more prone to use it. We've found that beta testing children using Peejamas learned to hold their urine at night much more quickly. Diapers are a crutch that only delay a child's ability to potty train at night.

 

 

Enter PEEJAMAS...

Peejamas are the result of the efforts of a group of parents over the past 1.5 years to make a substitute for diapers that improve the child's potty-training experience - helping the child learn more quickly, while helping ease the stress that parents often go through.

The final product is a pair of pajamas that are more affordable, convenient, sustainable, and also improve the psyche of the child. Where diapers have their inherent limitations (as mentioned above), Peejamas literally solve all of those problems.

 

 

Peejamas are more AFFORDABLE. We've done the math. Compared to nighttime diapers, Peejamas are 66% cheaper than diapers on a per usage basis. Consider then the cost of your kids' pajamas as well and the cost of Peejamas are 75%+ cheaper than the bundled price of diapers+pajamas. Cost-savings begin to be astronomically better for parents whose child may take longer to learn. 

Peejamas are more CONVENIENT. Ever roll the dice, not put your kid in a nighttime diaper, and then have her come in your room and tell you she wet the bed? Of course you have. Well, say "hasta luego" to both of those things. With Peejamas, no need to roll the dice with a diaper or worry about having to strip the sheets from the bed at 2 a.m. to do the wash.

Peejamas are more SUSTAINABLE. Remember what we said above about landfills? Diapers are literally one of the single most common pieces of waste contributing to U.S. landfills each year. So. Much. Waste. Though using water and electricity for laundry is obvious, the net positive impact Peejamas have on the environment is significant. 

Peejamas are BETTER FOR YOUR CHILD. We can't tell you how many parents have shared with us their frustrations with nighttime diapers: "My little girl just can't stop using a diaper.", "My baby is dry all day then pees every. single. night.", "My son is 7 and is STILL in Pull-Ups. It costs us a fortune!" By not wearing a diaper, children who use Peejamas don't have that known safety net to rely on. Rather, Peejamas appear - and feel - like your typical pair of pajamas (just more comfortable). By removing the false confidence that a diaper provides, the speed at which your child should become potty-trained increases exponentially. 

Peejamas are STILL PAJAMAS after potty-training ends. "What do we do with all these extra pull-ups now that little jane is potty-trained?!" is a question thousands of parents have asked. There the diapers sit - perhaps for years - wasting space in your house. Not so with Peejamas. Chances are, Peejamas will quickly become your child's favorite jammies because of their comfortable fabrics! Good news - even once potty-trained, they can continue wearing Peejamas!

 

 

 

A Snapshot of our e-book...

Join Penelope as she journeys around the world in search of food, friends, and new cultures!
story_txt:

So, How do They Work?
Peejamas' Patent Pending design uses the highest quality fabrics that absorb, capture, and contain fluid to keep your sheets from getting wet, your mattress from getting stained, and your night of rest uninterrupted.
Our super-absorbent fabrics will hold over 15X their weight in liquid!

story:
The Flux Adapt is unlike anything you've ever worn before. We designed this shoe to be the Ultimate Barefoot Athleisure shoe. It's the perfect balance of style and tech to support you in every activity throughout your day. Built to be as adaptable as you. 

 

 

• AdaptKnit™ Upper - Recycled knit with 4-way stretch and zoned reinforcement only where you need it. It’s everything you need and nothing you don’t. Plus its aesthetic is incredibly versatile for (almost) any occasion.

• AdaptSol™ Cushion - Patent-pending Adaptsol™ Footbed technology features independent, floating cushion pods that allow for greater control and spatial awareness. Your feet have never felt this alive.

• AdaptSol™ Tread - Patent-pending Adaptsol™ Tread works in tandem with the inner cushion to move with the unique contours of your foot, providing you with the most barefoot-like feel on the market without sacrificing on comfort. And the Adapt's unique hex-pattern tread offers exceptional grip on any terrain. 

 

 

The AdaptSol™ is comprised of two major components, the cushion and tread, which work in tandem to create a one-of-a kind experience for your feet. We built this shoe to be the most responsive, yet comfortable, fit of your life. We dare you, try and replicate this kind of responsiveness with any of the shoes you have in your closet!

 

 

 

• Lightweight - You won't even notice you're wearing shoes.

• Zero Drop - Keeps joints aligned and allows tendons full range of motion.

• Recycled Knit Upper with Performance Backer - Nice and airy, and better for the earth.

• 10mm AdaptSol™ Insole - Just enough cushioning, and increases spatial awareness.

• High Traction AdaptSol™ Tread - Great for any terrain.

• Unisex Sizing - 4-14 US Men / 6-16 W.

• Performance Width Toe Box - The "Goldilocks" of shoe widths.

• Adaptive Fit - Stretch Knit Upper + responsive AdaptSol™ tech allows your feet to move free.

• Vegan - No animals harmed!

• Machine Washable - That's right, no more stinky shoes.

• Reflective Logos - For your night workouts

                    

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Here’s a question for you, what do you get when you pair a former Reebok designer, an operational guru, and a tech wizard? The Flux Dream Team, of course!

Hi there, we’re Zach, Isaac, and Ben, and we’re on a mission to help you move better.

 

 

 

 

Follow us on social

    

Contact Us At

team@fluxfootwear.com

Risks & Challenges

As with any manufacturing, there are always small risks. The biggest concerns we can foresee are:

  • Timing - while we have worked through a timeline with our factory, there is always the potential for unknowns to cause delays. We have built in a bit of a buffer though, so this should not be an issue.
  • Overall Quality - While we have had great success working with this manufacturer so far, and they are true craftsmen when it comes to footwear, there is always the risk of quality in the production of any product. We are committed to overseeing the production process to the best of our abilities and ensuring that the product that reaches our customers is to the same standard as the samples we have been testing for the past year.

story:
Introducing the extraordinary uber-light yet incredibly sturdy artwear bags made by award winning artists worldwide on a mission to co-create, artify, stylize and revitalize our daily lives and art-starved hearts. One little bag at a time.

To our friends, fellow art-lovers and goofballers:

You’re our daily inspiration marching down the street. Our Stiglo is your Stiglo. Make our canvas your Backpack, your head turning Tote, your mood lifting Pouch. Let our artists become your personal style reviving, edge sharpening, whimsically nutrious adulting joy bag. 

 

We’ve come together from a variety of places and creative industries. Milos has a habit of building and leading internationally awarded creative and design teams across 3 continents. He’s both a seasoned Executive Creative Director and artist himself. Milan is a veteran Software Engineer behind the code that runs VR, CGI and other things that make gamers and creatives drool. Maria’s a Stylist with a design background, using fashion to creating unique worlds on commercial and blockbuster film sets. As a Producer in international art, design and media, Danica runs International Relations for the Faculty of Applied Arts in Belgrade with a history of activating young people to shape Youth and Education Policy in Serbia and the EU. Cindy’s a Creative Director and Writer in international advertising and content, curating the brands you’re wearing, driving, lusting (and hopefully not hating). Masha’s a rising illustrator, muralist, animator and artist liaison. And finally, Susan’s an experienced Fashion Designer and Consultant based in San Francisco to help keep us informed and on track as Stiglo marches forward.

 

 

Risks and challenges

We have made sure that our material suppliers are aware of our needs, but there is always a small risk of them being late to deliver.

Another potential risk is during transport to our fulfillment centers in EU & USA. Shipping will be insured, but if anything happens to a shipment it will take us additional time to collect the insurance and remake and re-ship the products.

Import duties and taxes are not included in our reward levels. These charges vary by country and are completely out of our control. On the bright side, our campaign is EU and USA friendly - we have fulfillment partners and ship from EU and USA to minimize transport costs for our backers.
